quotes.quote: He may not have been born withÂ guts, but he didn't have to die without them.
Follow your gut and your heart. You'll almost always make the right choice.
If you have theÂ gutsÂ to be yourself, other people'll pay your price.
What takes more guts? To fight for your own life at any cost - or prove that you're willing to lose it?Â
If you build the guts to do something, anything, then you better save enough to face the consequences
It takes confidence andÂ gutsÂ to intentionally create tension.
From the gut comes the strut, and where hunger reigns, strength abstains.
Have theÂ gutsÂ to be true to yourself. Nothing more.
If you greatly desire something, have the guts to stake everything on obtaining it.
There are times in all of our lives when a reliance on gut or intuition just seems more appropriate - when a particular course of action just feels right.
Your gut is your inner compass. Whenever you have to consult with other people for an answer, you're headed in the wrong direction.
Trust your gut. You know yourself, so don't let somebody else tell you who you are.
RealÂ gutsÂ are nothing more than developing your inner voice to the point where it is louder and stronger than the voice of your fear.
Don't ever second-guess a strong feeling that you have. Trust your gut.
You have to listen to what resonates within your own gut. You find your direction there. Your voice comes out.
Anybody with a little guts and the desire to apply himself can make it, he can make anything he wants to make of himself
It takes guts to realize you screwed up and to then come clean without any excuses.
Trusting your gut is always the best thing - no matter what people around you insist you should be doing or saying or thinking. Only you know and once you live in truth,your heart is completely free.
Always trust your gut and your intuition will steer you right, every time.
You've got to have theÂ gutsÂ not to be afraid to screw up.
There's a lot of blood, sweat, and guts between dreams and success.
If you greatly desire something, have theÂ gutsÂ to stake everything on obtaining it.
Ability and guts is an unbeatable combination.
What is the definition ofÂ guts? Grace under pressure.
Just go with your gut and communicate.
There's no substitute for guts.
Never ignore a gut feeling, but never believe that it's enough.
You must have theÂ gutsÂ to throw off the chains of modesty and mediocrity in order to be the light that the world needs.
TheÂ gutsÂ carry the feet, not the feet theÂ guts.
Your gut is always right.
Go with your gut, but use your head.
Gut health is the key to overall health.
It takes noÂ gutsÂ to be skeptical, it takesÂ gutsÂ to believe.
You can't coach guts and commitment.
It takes a lot ofÂ gutsÂ to stop measuring things that are measurable, and even moreÂ gutsÂ to create things that don't measure well by conventional means.
You just go with your gut instinct, because your gut is smarter than your heart.
If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
It's good to go with your gut instincts in life. You just should. Even if it doesn't work out, something good will come out of it.
Spilling yourÂ gutsÂ is just exactly as charming as it sounds.
If your heart, head and gut are telling you the same thing, then you owe it to yourself to chase it.

It takes guts to get out of the ruts.
Condition andÂ gutsÂ take over where knowledge and skill end.
Guts win more games than ability.
Always write from your gut, no matter what the project is.
It's one thing to haveÂ guts; it's another to be crazy.
If you've got theÂ gutsÂ to stick it out... you're going to make it.
It takes knowledge to know something. It takes guts to do what you know.

Guts are a combination of confidence, courage, conviction, strength of character, stick-to-itiveness, pugnaciousness, backbone, and intestinal fortitude. They are mandatory for anyone who wants to get to and stay at the top
